creator: sreddy@realm.com
text:
Configuration details

Apache/2.0.48(ssl module enabled) as frontend webserver which is used for 
static pages & images serving purpose

Using mod_jk.so to forward servlet requsts to jakarta-tomcat-4.1.29 in the 
backend (Using ajp13 protocol)

Problem: Some times .gif some images are not showing up but if we refresh IE, 
images comes back. It dows not happen every time. I did not see any errors in 
log files.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
Are images served by Apache or by Tomcat?  (I assume Apache.)

Is problem specific to SSL?

Is mod_deflate in use?  If so, disable compression of gif images and try again.

IE has some problems in the combination of SSL and compression which sometimes
are "resolved" by pressing reload button, but it is worth ensuring that no
compression is being done regardless.

creator: sreddy@realm.com
text:
Yes, Images are served by Apache & the problem is specific to SSL

but /usr/local/apache2/bin>./httpd -l|grep -i deflate 
shows me no mod_deflate in the list.

I guess that I am not using mod_deflate

Yes, I am seeing the same thing too...running Apache 2.049 on Windows XP,
fully patched. See http://lightning.niu.edu/weblight.gif on a Pentium 3
500 MHZ machine, 256 MB ram. I am using SSL but not mod_deflate. What can I do?
creator: sebenste@weather.admin.niu.edu

text:
Please re-open if this is reproducible with 2.0.54; there have eeb many changes
to mod_ssl since 2.0.48.
creator: jorton@redhat.com
